meanings.sent1: The plant in the corner is deader than the one by the window.
meanings.sent2: The flowers in the vase are getting deader each day.
meanings.sent3: The deader batteries in the remote refused to work anymore.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm for the project was deader than a doornail.
meanings.sent5: The deader leaves on the tree rustled in the wind.

meanings.sent1: The fire grew deader as the night went on.
meanings.sent2: The deader silence of the night was unsettling.
meanings.sent3: The deader end of the street was eerily quiet.
meanings.sent4: His hopes for success were deader than a doornail.
meanings.sent5: The deader look in her eyes told a story of loss.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is dead.
meanings.sent1: The cemetery was filled with the deader of the town.
meanings.sent2: The deader lay peacefully in their final resting place.
meanings.sent3: The deader of the party was the cake that nobody touched.
meanings.sent4: The deader of the two cars was beyond repair.
meanings.sent5: The deader of the two options seemed more appealing.
